title: Large-Scale: Comparative Effectiveness of Pre-Mathematics Education Programs: Synchronous Remote vs. On-Campus Tutorials

context.additional_context: Comparative study of blended tutorials reflecting the post-COVID increase in non-face-to-face education demand. Analysis required of the impact of learners' prior knowledge levels and affective characteristics on educational effectiveness.

learning_goals: Learners improve math problem-solving abilities by over 20% in synchronous remote and on-campus tutorials

Learners select self-paced tutorials (video, simulation, hands-on manuals) matching their proficiency level (beginner/intermediate/advanced) based on diagnostic assessments and successfully complete over 80% of practical assignments by course completion
Learners enhance mathematical self-efficacy by over 15%
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
